intro: Calamintha annua, commonly known as annual caraway, is an herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, dill, and fennel, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a spicy, caraway-like scent when crushed. Calamintha annua is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
